title: 'If you look at our advantage, the sums look very nice' – why Hays Travel’s owners bought Thomas Cook’s stores
text:
Fanfare and emotion surrounded Hays Travel’s surprise swoop last week for the entire 555-store network of the failed Thomas Cook. Up to 2,500 redundant employees will get their jobs back and the deal will create another 100 at the independent travel agent’s Sunderland headquarters.

Hays’ owners have been hailed in some quarters as heroes, championing a brand of capitalism that prioritises employee wellbeing and quality customer service over the ruthless cost-cutting promoted by private equity and management consultants.

John Hays, 70, and his wife Irene, 65, who own and run Hays Travel, have played along with the feel-good story. But as they lift the lid on the rationale behind the deal, a...
